XPath/XQuery/XQueryX Full Text Interoperability Test Suite

[Version: 1.0.2 Catalog Design Date: 2008-02-18]

Introduction

The following document is an XSLT transform of the XQuery and XPath Full Text 1.0 test catalog. The test catalog is an XML file containing meta-data about the XQuery interoperability tests published by the FTTF. The meta-data serves to link test queries with their required input sources and results as well as providing further information about the tests (e.g. who the author was, what the purpose of the test is) and categorizing the various tests into their relevant sections. For further information and details about this catalog file, please visit the FTTF homepage at http://www.w3.org/XML/Query/full-text-test-suite/.

Citations

Name Description Note
XQueryFullText XQuery and XPath Full Text 1.0
XQuery XQuery 1.0: An XML Query Language
FuncOps XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Functions and Operators
DataModel XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Data Model
FormalSemantics XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Formal Semantics
SchemaPart2 XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes
Schema-Errata XML Schema Errata Current practice is to have one Errata document for all parts of Schema.
XQueryX XML Syntax for XQuery 1.0 (XQueryX)
Serialization XSLT 2.0 and XQuery 1.0 Serialization
FTUseCases XQuery and XPath Full Text 1.0 Use Cases
UseCases XML Query Use Cases

Comparators

Name Description
XML The XML InfoSets should be canonicalized and compared.
Fragment A 'fragment' refers to an XML based instance which has multiple top-level elements and NO XML declaration. The comparator for this should simply wrap the entire fragment in a container element and perform XML comparison.
Text Each line of non-whitespace text should match. New-line sequences may vary and should be neutralized. Due to issues with the XML serialization of certain characters (e.g. '<'), it is not possible to simply compare the actual and expected results. Rather (as is the case with the 'Fragment' comparator) the test harness should convert the results into valid XML (by adding a container element) and perform comparison on the XML canonicalized versions of the results.
Ignore Only the presence/absence of this file is significant, not its content.
Inspect Automated comparison is not possible. the output should be inspected by a human.

Scenarios

Name Description
standard A query this is expected to produce valid results. Principal input should always be specified, even if the query doesn't have any PathExpr.
parse-error A query this is expected to raise a parsing/syntax error at query parse time. Principal input should always be specified, even if the query doesn't have any PathExpr.
runtime-error A query this is expected to raise a runtime error at query parse time. Runtime errors in this case include those raised by static typing rules. Principal input should always be specified, even if the query doesn't have any PathExpr.

Roles

Name Description
principal-data This is the source that is handed in to the processor as the initial input sequence, setting the "evaluation context" as described in XQuery chapter 2.
supplemental-data These are sources that may be read by functions such as fn:document() as the query is evaluated.
schema These are schema definitions that may be referenced by sources or in the query.
dtd These are dtd definitions that may be referenced by sources or in the query.
stopwords This is a list of stop words, one per line, to indicate the desired set of stop words referenced by the query.
thesaurus This is a thesaurus, represented in XML according to the thesaurus.xsd schema, to indicate the desired thesaurus information in a thesaurus referenced by the query.
stemming-dictionary This is a list of stemming relationships, one per line, where each whitespace-separated token on the line should stem to the first token on the line. It is used to indicate the desired stemming behaviour expected by the query.
principal This is an output (either text or XML) that will contain the query results. If the processor invocation sequence accepts a filename for results, this name may be passed, possibly prefixed by a partial directory path to allow storage of the results in a separate directory tree.
console-log This is an output (text file tagged .log) that will contain the captured "console" output for a command-line invocation, or equivalent messages from a harness. The main goal is to capture error messages that came from the processor.

Sources

ID Creator Schema File Description
XQFTTSCatalog Full-Text Task Force XQFTTSCatalogxsd XQFTTSCatalog.xml XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Full-Text Test Suite Catalog
ftusecases Full-Text Task Force ftusecasesxsd TestSources/ftusecases.xml Example used in XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Full-Text Use Cases
ftbookexample Liam Quin ftbookexamplexsd TestSources/ftbookexample.xml XML suitable for example queries in the Full Text specification
ftspec Full-Text Task Force xslquerydtd TestSources/xpath-full-text-10.xml The Full Text spec itself
emptydoc David Marston TestSources/emptydoc.xml Contains just a "doc" element, no comments/text/PIs.
FT-3-examples-source-document Jim Melton TestSources/FT-3-examples-source-document.xml Contains a "books" element containing a single "book" element.
FT-37-Example Mary Holstege TestSources/FT-37-Example.xml Contains sample from section 3.7.
ftemptynode Full-Text Task Force TestSources/ftemptynode.xml Example to support queries matching empty nodes.

Schemas

ID Type URI File Name
XQFTTSCatalogxsd http://www.w3.org/2005/02/query-test-full-text XQFTTSCatalog.xsd
ftusecasesxsd TestSources/ftusecases.xsd
ftbookexamplexsd TestSources/ftbookexample.xsd
xslquerydtd TestSources/xsl-query.dtd

1.1.1Section 2.2.2

Examples Section 2.2.2

    examples-222-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
    Description:
    Find the author of each book with a title containing a token with the same root as dog and the token cat.
    Spec Citations:
    #section-ftcontainsexpr-examples
    Query:
    Queries/XQuery/Examples/2.2.2-Examples/examples-222-q1.xq
    Inputs:
    Role: principal-data Source ID: ftbookexample
    Outputs:
    Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Examples/2.2.2-Examples/ft-222-examples-results-q1.txt

    examples-222-q1b Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
    Description:
    Find the author of each book with a title containing a token with the same root as dog and the token cat.
    Spec Citations:
    #section-ftcontainsexpr-examples
    Query: (XPath 2.0)
    Queries/XQuery/Examples/2.2.2-Examples/examples-222-q1b.xq
    Inputs:
    Role: principal-data Source ID: ftbookexample
    Outputs:
    Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Examples/2.2.2-Examples/ft-222-examples-results-q1b.txt

    examples-222-q2 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
    Description:
    Find books that have a price of less than 50 and a title which contains a token with the same root as train.
    Spec Citations:
    #section-ftcontainsexpr-examples
    Query:
    Queries/XQuery/Examples/2.2.2-Examples/examples-222-q2.xq
    Inputs:
    Role: principal-data Source ID: ftbookexample
    Outputs:
    Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Examples/2.2.2-Examples/ft-222-examples-results-q2.txt

    examples-222-q3 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
    Description:
    Finds books where either the title contains the token dog and the token cat and the content does not contain a token with the same root as train, or where the title fails to have one of the matching tokens but the content does.
    Spec Citations:
    #section-ftcontainsexpr-examples
    Query:
    Queries/XQuery/Examples/2.2.2-Examples/examples-222-q3.xq
    Inputs:
    Role: principal-data Source ID: ftbookexample
    Outputs:
    Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Examples/2.2.2-Examples/ft-222-examples-results-q3.txt

    1.1.2Section 2.3

    Examples Section 2.3

      examples-23-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
      Description:
      Return scores for books whose content contains "web site" and "usability" and whose title contains "testing"
      Spec Citations:
      #section-score-variables
      Query: (XPath 2.0)
      Queries/XQuery/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q1.xq
      Inputs:
      Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
      Outputs:
      Role: principal Comparator: Inspect Results/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q1.txt
      Error: err:FTST0014

      examples-23-q2 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
      Description:
      Return titles and scores for books whose content contains "web site" and "usability" where the score is more than 0.5
      Spec Citations:
      #section-score-variables
      Query:
      Queries/XQuery/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q2.xq
      Inputs:
      Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
      Outputs:
      Role: principal Comparator: Inspect Results/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q2.txt
      Error: err:FTST0014

      examples-23-q3 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
      Description:
      Return paragraphs containing "usability" of books whose title contains "software", ordered by score
      Spec Citations:
      #section-score-variables
      Query:
      Queries/XQuery/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q3.xq
      Inputs:
      Role: principal-data Source ID: ftbookexample
      Outputs:
      Role: principal Comparator: Fragment Results/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q3.txt
      Role: principal Comparator: Fragment Results/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q3-alt.txt
      Error: err:FTST0014

      examples-23-q4 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
      Description:
      Return paragraphs containing "usability" of books whose title contains "software", ordered by score
      Spec Citations:
      #section-score-variables
      Query:
      Queries/XQuery/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q4.xq
      Inputs:
      Role: principal-data Source ID: ftbookexample
      Outputs:
      Role: principal Comparator: Fragment Results/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q4.txt
      Role: principal Comparator: Fragment Results/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q4-alt.txt
      Error: err:FTST0014

      examples-23-q5 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
      Description:
      Return books whose chapter title contains "testing", ordered by the score of their content containing "web site" and "usability"
      Spec Citations:
      #section-score-variables
      Query:
      Queries/XQuery/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q5.xq
      Inputs:
      Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
      Outputs:
      Role: principal Comparator: Inspect Results/Examples/2.3-ScoreVariables/examples-23-q5.txt
      Error: err:FTST0014

      1.1.3Section 2.3.1

      Examples Section 2.3.1

        examples-231-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
        Description:
        Return books with a score based on weighting "web site" in their content 0.5 and "usability" in their content 2
        Spec Citations:
        #section-using-weights
        Query:
        Queries/XQuery/Examples/2.3.1-UsingWeightsWithinAScoredFTContainsExpr/examples-231-q1.xq
        Inputs:
        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
        Outputs:
        Role: principal Comparator: Inspect Results/Examples/2.3.1-UsingWeightsWithinAScoredFTContainsExpr/examples-231-q1.txt
        Error: err:FTST0014

        1.1.4Section 3.2

        Examples from Section 3.2

          ft-3.2-examples-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Jim Melton
          Description:
          Returns the sample book element, because its title element contains the token "Expert"
          Spec Citations:
          #ftwords
          Query: (XPath 2.0)
          Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.2-SearchTokensAndPhrases/ft-3.2-examples-q1.xq
          Inputs:
          Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document (as context item)
          Outputs:
          Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Examples/3.2-SearchTokensAndPhrases/ft-3.2-examples-q1.xml

          ft-3.2-examples-q2 Scenario: standard Creator: Jim Melton
          Description:
          Returns the sample book element, because its title element contains the phrase "Expert Reviews"
          Spec Citations:
          #ftwords
          Query: (XPath 2.0)
          Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.2-SearchTokensAndPhrases/ft-3.2-examples-q2.xq
          Inputs:
          Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document (as context item)
          Outputs:
          Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Examples/3.2-SearchTokensAndPhrases/ft-3.2-examples-q2.xml

          ft-3.2-examples-q3 Scenario: standard Creator: Jim Melton
          Description:
          Returns the sample book element, because its title element contains the two tokens "Expert" and "Reviews"
          Spec Citations:
          #ftwords
          Query: (XPath 2.0)
          Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.2-SearchTokensAndPhrases/ft-3.2-examples-q3.xq
          Inputs:
          Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document (as context item)
          Outputs:
          Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Examples/3.2-SearchTokensAndPhrases/ft-3.2-examples-q3.xml

          ft-3.2-examples-q4 Scenario: standard Creator: Jim Melton
          Description:
          Returns false for the sample document, because the p element doesn't contain the phrase "Web Site Usability" although it contains all of the tokens in the phrase
          Spec Citations:
          #ftwords
          Query: (XPath 2.0)
          Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.2-SearchTokensAndPhrases/ft-3.2-examples-q4.xq
          Inputs:
          Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document (as context item)
          Outputs:
          Role: principal Comparator: Text Results/Examples/3.2-SearchTokensAndPhrases/ft-3.2-examples-q4.txt

          ft-3.2-examples-q5 Scenario: standard Creator: Jim Melton
          Description:
          Returns book numbers of book elements by "Marigold" with a title about "Web Site Usability", sorting them in descending score order
          Spec Citations:
          #ftwords
          Query:
          Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.2-SearchTokensAndPhrases/ft-3.2-examples-q5.xq
          Inputs:
          Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document (as context item)
          Outputs:
          Role: principal Comparator: Inspect Results/Examples/3.2-SearchTokensAndPhrases/ft-3.2-examples-q5.txt

          1.1.5Section 3.3

          Examples from Section 3.3

            ft-3.3-examples-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Jim Melton
            Description:
            Returns the example book element's number, because the book element contains 2 or more occurrences of "usability"
            Spec Citations:
            #fttimes
            Query: (XPath 2.0)
            Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.3-CardinalitySelection/ft-3.3-examples-q1.xq
            Inputs:
            Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document (as context item)
            Outputs:
            Role: principal Comparator: Text Results/Examples/3.3-CardinalitySelection/ft-3.3-examples-q1.txt
            Error: err:FTST0005

            ft-3.3-examples-q2 Scenario: standard Creator: Jim Melton
            Description:
            Returns the empty sequence, because there are 3 occurrences of {"usability", "testing"} any in the designated title
            Spec Citations:
            #fttimes
            Query: (XPath 2.0)
            Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.3-CardinalitySelection/ft-3.3-examples-q2.xq
            Inputs:
            Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document (as context item)
            Outputs:
            Role: principal Comparator: Fragment Results/Examples/3.3-CardinalitySelection/ft-3.3-examples-q2.xml
            Error: err:FTST0005

              ft-3.4-examples-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force

                ft-3.4.1-examples-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force

                Error: err:FTST0009
                Error: err:FTST0013

                1.1.8Section 3.4.2

                Examples Section 3.4.2

                  ft-3.4.2-examples-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                  Description:
                  Find out whether it is true that the document contains "improv.*" allowing zero or more characters at the end.
                  Spec Citations:
                  #ftwildcardoption
                  Query: (XPath 2.0)
                  Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.4.2-WildcardOption/ft-3.4.2-examples-q1.xq
                  Inputs:
                  Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                  Outputs:
                  Role: principal Comparator: Text Results/Examples/3.4.2-WildcardOption/ft-3.4.2-examples-results-q1.txt

                  ft-3.4.2-examples-q2 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                  Description:
                  Find out whether it is true that the document contains ".?site" allowing zero or one character at the start.
                  Spec Citations:
                  #ftwildcardoption
                  Query: (XPath 2.0)
                  Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.4.2-WildcardOption/ft-3.4.2-examples-q2.xq
                  Inputs:
                  Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                  Outputs:
                  Role: principal Comparator: Text Results/Examples/3.4.2-WildcardOption/ft-3.4.2-examples-results-q2.txt

                  ft-3.4.2-examples-q3 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                  Description:
                  Find out whether it is true that the document contains "w.ll" allowing one inserted character at the period.
                  Spec Citations:
                  #ftwildcardoption
                  Query: (XPath 2.0)
                  Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.4.2-WildcardOption/ft-3.4.2-examples-q3.xq
                  Inputs:
                  Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                  Outputs:
                  Role: principal Comparator: Text Results/Examples/3.4.2-WildcardOption/ft-3.4.2-examples-results-q3.txt

                  ft-3.4.2-examples-q4 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                  Description:
                  Find out whether it is true that the document contains "w.ll" expecting a period at the period.
                  Spec Citations:
                  #ftwildcardoption
                  Query: (XPath 2.0)
                  Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.4.2-WildcardOption/ft-3.4.2-examples-q4.xq
                  Inputs:
                  Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                  Outputs:
                  Role: principal Comparator: Text Results/Examples/3.4.2-WildcardOption/ft-3.4.2-examples-results-q4.txt

                  1.1.9Section 3.4.3

                  Examples Section 3.4.3

                    ft-3.4.3-examples-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                    Description:
                    Find out whether it is true that by searching on duty and on its synonyms you will find task.
                    Spec Citations:
                    #ftthesaurusoption
                    Query: (XPath 2.0)
                    Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.4.3-ThesaurusOption/ft-3.4.3-examples-q1.xq
                    Inputs:
                    Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                    Role: thesaurus Source ID: usability (as auxiliary URI)
                    Outputs:
                    Role: principal Comparator: Text Results/Examples/3.4.3-ThesaurusOption/ft-3.4.3-examples-results-q1.txt

                    ft-3.4.3-examples-q2 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                    Description:
                    Find people or its narrower terms.
                    Spec Citations:
                    #ftthesaurusoption
                    Query: (XPath 2.0)
                    Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.4.3-ThesaurusOption/ft-3.4.3-examples-q2.xq
                    Inputs:
                    Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                    Role: thesaurus Source ID: usability (as auxiliary URI)
                    Outputs:
                    Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Examples/3.4.3-ThesaurusOption/ft-3.4.3-examples-results-q2.xml

                                                Outputs:
                                                Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Examples/3.6.5-AnchoringSelection/examples-365-3.xml
                                                Error: err:FTST0012

                                                  1.2Expressions

                                                  1.2.1Tests of For-Let-Where-OrderBy-Return Expressions

                                                  Tests in this group focus on score variables in FLWOR expressions in Full-Text 2.3.

                                                  • 1.2.1.2Let Clause with Score variable

                                                      Description:
                                                      Positive test to demonstrate that queries comprising an FTPrimary that is an FTWords are supported.
                                                      Spec Citations:
                                                      #ftselections
                                                      Query:
                                                      Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/FTPrimary-FTExtensionSelection-q1.xq
                                                      Inputs:
                                                      Role: principal-data Source ID: ftspec
                                                      Outputs:
                                                      Role: principal Comparator: Ignore Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/FTPrimary-FTExtensionSelection-q1_result.xml

                                                      1.2.2.1.1.1.1Full-Text Tokens and Phrases

                                                      Section 3.2.

                                                        1.2.2.1.1.1.2Full-Text Cardinality Selection

                                                        Cardinality selection. Section 3.3

                                                          FTSelection-FTTimes-q1a Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force, Jim

                                                          Inputs:
                                                          Role: principal-data Source ID: ftspec
                                                          Outputs:
                                                          Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/FTTimes/FTSelection-FTTimes-q3a_result.xml
                                                          Error: err:FTST0005

                                                          1.2.2.1.1.1.3Full-Text Operators

                                                          Logical Full-Text operators. Section 3.5.

                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.1Full-Text ftor Operator
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.2Full-Text ftand Operator
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.3Full-Text ftnot Operator
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.4Full-Text not in Operator
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.5Full-text Match Options
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.6Full-Text Language Match Option
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.7Full-Text Wildcard Match Option
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.8Full-Text Thesaurus Match Option
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.9Full-Text Stemming Match Option
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.10Full-Text Case Match Option
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.11Full-Text Diacritics Match Option
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.12Full-Text Stop Word Match Option.
                                                          • 1.2.2.1.1.1.3.13Full-Text Extension Option

                                                          1.2.2.1.1.1.3.1Full-Text ftor Operator

                                                                #sec-ftnot

                                                                  1.2.2.1.1.1.3.5Full-text Match Options

                                                                  Full-text match options. Section 3.4.

                                                                    ftmatchoptions-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                    Description:
                                                                    There can be multiple match options applied to an FTWord, written in any order (although there are constraints on processing order). This query applies multiple match options in a random order.
                                                                    Spec Citations:
                                                                    #ftmatchoptions
                                                                    Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                    Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/ftmatchoptions-q1.xq
                                                                    Inputs:
                                                                    Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                    Role: stemming-dictionary Source ID: english (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                    Role: stopwords Source ID: stopwords1 (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                    Role: thesaurus Source ID: usability (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                    Outputs:
                                                                    Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/ftmatchoptions-results-q1.xml
                                                                    Error: err:FTST0006
                                                                    Error: err:FTST0009

                                                                    ftmatchoptions-q2 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                    Description:
                                                                    There can be multiple match options applied to an FTSelection, written in any order (although there are constraints on processing order). This query applies multiple match options in a random order.
                                                                    Spec Citations:
                                                                    #ftmatchoptions
                                                                    Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                    Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/ftmatchoptions-q2.xq
                                                                    Inputs:
                                                                    Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                    Role: stemming-dictionary Source ID: english (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                    Role: thesaurus Source ID: usability (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                    Outputs:
                                                                    Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/ftmatchoptions-results-q2.xml

                                                                    ftmatchoptions-q3 Scenario: runtime-error Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                    Description:
                                                                    Only one match option from any given match option group may be applied to an FTWord or FTSelection. This query applies both stemming and no stemming to test and returns an error.
                                                                    Spec Citations:
                                                                    #ftmatchoptions
                                                                    Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                    Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/ftmatchoptions-q3.xq
                                                                    Inputs:
                                                                    Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                    Role: stemming-dictionary Source ID: english (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                    Outputs:
                                                                    Error: err:FTST0019

                                                                    ftmatchoptions-q4 Scenario: runtime-error Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                    Description:
                                                                    Only one match option from any given match option group may be applied to an FTWord or FTSelection. This query applies both case sensitive and case insensitive to Complete and returns an error.
                                                                    Spec Citations:
                                                                    #ftmatchoptions
                                                                    Query:
                                                                    Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/ftmatchoptions-q4.xq
                                                                    Inputs:
                                                                    Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                    Outputs:
                                                                    Error: err:FTST0019
                                                                    Error: err:FOCH0002

                                                                      1.2.2.1.1.1.3.7Full-Text Wildcard Match Option

                                                                      Wildcard option. Section 3.4.2.

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Wildcard default query. Same as without wildcards. Find site without wildcards.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q1.xq
                                                                        Inputs:
                                                                        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: Fragment Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q1.txt

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q2 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Without wildcard query containing a period. The period is a period, not an indicator. Depending on the tokenization find "site" or "site." ending in a period.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q2.xq
                                                                        Inputs:
                                                                        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: Inspect Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q2.xml
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: Inspect Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q2b.txt

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q3 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using wildcard (suffix) query containing a period. The period is an indicator. Find site. where the indicator is replaced by any one character.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q3.xq
                                                                        Inputs:
                                                                        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: Fragment Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q3.txt

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q4 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using wildcard query containing a question mark not preceded by a period. There is no period, no indicator. Find site? where the question mark is a question mark.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q4.xq
                                                                        Inputs:
                                                                        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q4.xml

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q5 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using no wildcard query containing a period and a question mark. The period is a period. The question mark is a question mark. Depending on the tokenization find "site" or "site.?" where the period is a period and the question mark is a question mark.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q5.xq
                                                                        Inputs:
                                                                        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: Inspect Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q5.txt
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: Inspect Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q5b.txt

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q6 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using wildcard (suffix) query containing a period and a question mark. The period is an indicator. The question mark is a qualifier. Find site.? where the period and the question mark are replaced by zero or one characters.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query:
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q6.xq

                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using wildcard (suffix) query containing a period and a question mark. The period is an indicator. The question mark is a qualifier. Find completi.? where the period and the question mark are replaced by zero or one characters.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query:
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q7.xq

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q8 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using wildcard (suffix) query containing a period and an asterisk. The period is an indicator. The asterisk is a qualifier. Find completi.* where the period and the asterisk are replaced by zero or more characters.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query:
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q8.xq

                                                                        Outputs:

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q9 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using wildcard (suffix) query containing a period and a plus sign. The period is an indicator. The plus sign is a qualifier. Find completi.+ where the period and the plus sign are replaced by one or more characters.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query:
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q9.xq
                                                                        Inputs:
                                                                        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q9.xml

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q10 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using wildcard (infix) query containing a period and two numbers separated by a period enclosed in curly braces. The period is an indicator. The two numbers separated by a period enclosed in curly braces is a qualifier. Find a word that begins with u, ends with e, and has 3-4 characters between the u and the e.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query:
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q10.xq
                                                                        Inputs:
                                                                        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: Fragment Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q10.xml

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q11 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using wildcard (prefix) query containing a period and two numbers separated by a period enclosed in curly braces. The period is an indicator. The two numbers separated by a period enclosed in curly braces is a qualifier. Find a word that ends with proved, and has 0-2 beginning characters.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query:
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q11.xq
                                                                        Inputs:
                                                                        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: Fragment Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q11.txt

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q12 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using wildcard (prefix and suffix) query containing two indicators and two qualifiers. Find a word containing view with zero or more additional beginning characters and one or more ending characters.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query:
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q12.xq
                                                                        Inputs:
                                                                        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q12.xml

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q13 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using wildcard (suffix) query with a backslash preceding the period. Find specialist\. where the period is a period, not an indicator.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query:
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q13.xq
                                                                        Inputs:
                                                                        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q13.xml

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q14 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Using wildcard (suffix) query with a backslash preceding the question mark. Find next.\? where the period is a indicator and the question mark is a queston mark, not a qualifier.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query:
                                                                        Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-q14.xq
                                                                        Inputs:
                                                                        Role: principal-data Source ID: ftusecases
                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTWildcard/ftwildcard-results-q14.xml

                                                                        ft-3.4.2-expressions-q15 Scenario: runtime-error Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                        Description:
                                                                        Bad syntax in wildcard range query -- 1 number not 2.
                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                        #ftwildcardoption
                                                                        Query:

                                                                        Outputs:
                                                                        Error: err:FTDY0020

                                                                                1.2.2.1.1.1.3.12Full-Text Stop Word Match Option.

                                                                                Stop Word option. Section 3.4.7.

                                                                                  ft-3.4.7-expressions-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                  Description:
                                                                                  Find propagating (allow any intervening word) errors. This query calls a default stop word list. The default stop word list is stopword1.
                                                                                  Spec Citations:
                                                                                  #ftstopwordoption
                                                                                  Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                                  Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTStopWord/ftstopword-q1.xq
                                                                                  Inputs:
                                                                                  Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                                                                                  Role: stopwords Source ID: stopwords1def (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                                  Outputs:
                                                                                  Role: principal Comparator: Fragment Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTStopWord/ftstopword-results-q1.xml
                                                                                  Error: err:FTST0006
                                                                                  Error: err:FTST0008

                                                                                  ft-3.4.7-expressions-q2 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                  Description:
                                                                                  Find propagating numerous errors. This query calls a stop word list via a url excluding stop words in a second stop word list also accessed via url.
                                                                                  Spec Citations:
                                                                                  #ftstopwordoption
                                                                                  Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                                  Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTStopWord/ftstopword-q2.xq
                                                                                  Inputs:
                                                                                  Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                                                                                  Role: stopwords Source ID: stopwords1 (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                                  Role: stopwords Source ID: stopwords2 (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                                  Outputs:
                                                                                  Role: principal Comparator: Fragment Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTStopWord/ftstopword-results-q2.xml
                                                                                  Error: err:FTST0006
                                                                                  Error: err:FTST0008

                                                                                  ft-3.4.7-expressions-q3 Scenario: runtime-error Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                  Description:
                                                                                  Find propagating numerous errors. This query calls a stop word list that does not exist.
                                                                                  Spec Citations:
                                                                                  #ftstopwordoption
                                                                                  Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                                  Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTStopWord/ftstopword-q3.xq
                                                                                  Inputs:
                                                                                  Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                                                                                  Role: stopwords Source ID: stopwords3 (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                                  Outputs:
                                                                                  Error: err:FTST0008

                                                                                  ft-3.4.7-expressions-q4 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                  Description:
                                                                                  Find supports some users of. This query calls the union of 2 stop word lists.
                                                                                  Spec Citations:
                                                                                  #ftstopwordoption
                                                                                  Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                                  Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTStopWord/ftstopword-q4.xq
                                                                                  Inputs:
                                                                                  Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                                                                                  Role: stopwords Source ID: stopwords1 (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                                  Role: stopwords Source ID: stopwords2 (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                                  Outputs:
                                                                                  Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTStopWord/ftstopword-results-q4.xml
                                                                                  Error: err:FTST0006

                                                                                  ft-3.4.7-expressions-q5 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                  Description:
                                                                                  Find supports some users of. This query calls the union of a stop word list and a string literal.
                                                                                  Spec Citations:
                                                                                  #ftstopwordoption
                                                                                  Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                                  Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTStopWord/ftstopword-q5.xq
                                                                                  Inputs:
                                                                                  Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                                                                                  Role: stopwords Source ID: stopwords1 (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                                  Outputs:
                                                                                  Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/MatchOptions/FTStopWord/ftstopword-results-q5.xml
                                                                                  Error: err:FTST0006

                                                                                  ft-3.4.7-expressions-q6 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force

                                                                                          1.2.2.1.1.1.4.4Scope Selection

                                                                                          Scope selection. Section 3.6.4. FTScope is an optional feature: here we allow error FTST0004

                                                                                            FTScope-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                            Description:
                                                                                            same sentence
                                                                                            Spec Citations:
                                                                                            #ftscope
                                                                                            Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                                            Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/PositionalFilters/FTScope/FTScope-q1.xq
                                                                                            Inputs:
                                                                                            Role: principal-data Source ID: emptydoc
                                                                                            Outputs:
                                                                                            Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/PositionalFilters/FTScope/FTScope-q1.xml
                                                                                            Error: err:FTST0004
                                                                                            Error: err:FTST0003

                                                                                            FTScope-q2 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                            Description:
                                                                                            different sentence
                                                                                            Spec Citations:
                                                                                            #ftscope
                                                                                            Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                                            Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/PositionalFilters/FTScope/FTScope-q2.xq
                                                                                            Inputs:
                                                                                            Role: principal-data Source ID: emptydoc
                                                                                            Outputs:
                                                                                            Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/PositionalFilters/FTScope/FTScope-q2.xml
                                                                                            Error: err:FTST0004
                                                                                            Error: err:FTST0003

                                                                                            FTScope-q3 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                            Description:
                                                                                            same paragraph
                                                                                            Spec Citations:
                                                                                            #ftscope
                                                                                            Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                                            Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/PositionalFilters/FTScope/FTScope-q3.xq
                                                                                            Inputs:
                                                                                            Role: principal-data Source ID: emptydoc
                                                                                            Outputs:
                                                                                            Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTSelection/PositionalFilters/FTScope/FTScope-q3.xml
                                                                                            Error: err:FTST0004
                                                                                            Error: err:FTST0003

                                                                                            FTScope-q4 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                            Description:
                                                                                            different paragraph

                                                                                            #ftscope

                                                                                                      2Optional Features

                                                                                                      • 2.1Full-Text not in Operator
                                                                                                      • 2.2Unconstrained Full-Text ftnot Operator
                                                                                                      • 2.3Unconstrained FTUnit/FTBigUnit
                                                                                                      • 2.4Unconstrained Order Selection
                                                                                                      • 2.5Scope Selection
                                                                                                      • 2.6Unconstrained Window Selection
                                                                                                      • 2.7Unconstrained Distance Selection
                                                                                                      • 2.8Full-Text Cardinality Selection
                                                                                                      • 2.9Anchoring Selection
                                                                                                      • 2.10Unconstrained Full-Text Case Option
                                                                                                      • 2.11Unconstrained Full-Text Stop Word Option
                                                                                                      • 2.12Unconstrained Full-Text Language Option
                                                                                                      • 2.13Unconstrained Ignore Option
                                                                                                      • 2.14Unconstrained Scoring
                                                                                                      • 2.15Unconstrained Weight Range

                                                                                                      2.1Full-Text not in Operator

                                                                                                      Mild not. Sections 3.5.3 and 5.2.1.

                                                                                                        unconstrained-examples-353-1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                                        Description:
                                                                                                        Does any book contain "usability" not in "usability testing"?
                                                                                                        Spec Citations:
                                                                                                        #id-ftmildnot-option
                                                                                                        Query: (XPath 2.0)

                                                                                                                          2.11Unconstrained Full-Text Stop Word Option

                                                                                                                          Stop-word option. Sections 3.4.7 and 5.2.11.

                                                                                                                            ft-5.2.11-examples-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                                                            Description:
                                                                                                                            Find out whether or not it is true that the document contains propagating few errors. Stop words are provided in the query. One of the stop words is in the phrase queried.
                                                                                                                            Spec Citations:
                                                                                                                            #ftstopwordoption
                                                                                                                            Query: (XPath 2.0)
                                                                                                                            Queries/XQuery/Examples/3.4.7-StopWordOption/ft-3.4.7-examples-q1.xq
                                                                                                                            Inputs:
                                                                                                                            Role: principal-data Source ID: FT-3-examples-source-document
                                                                                                                            Role: stemming-dictionary Source ID: english (as auxiliary URI)
                                                                                                                            Outputs:
                                                                                                                            Role: principal Comparator: Text Results/Examples/3.4.7-StopWordOption/ft-3.4.7-examples-results-q1.txt

                                                                                                                            ft-5.2.11-examples-q2 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                                                            Description:
                                                                                                                            Find out whether or not it is true that the document contains propagating errors. Stop words are provided in the query. The stop word is not in phrase queried.
                                                                                                                            Spec Citations:
                                                                                                                            #ftstopwordoption

                                                                                                                            2.12Unconstrained Full-Text Language Option

                                                                                                                              2.13Unconstrained Ignore Option

                                                                                                                              FTIgnore. Sections 3.7 and 5.2.13.

                                                                                                                                FTIgnore-unconstrained-q1 Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force
                                                                                                                                Description:
                                                                                                                                Ignore titles, return titles
                                                                                                                                Spec Citations:
                                                                                                                                #id-ftignore-option
                                                                                                                                Query:
                                                                                                                                Queries/XQuery/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTIgnoreOption/FTIgnore-q1.xq
                                                                                                                                Inputs:
                                                                                                                                Role: principal-data Source ID: ftbookexample
                                                                                                                                Outputs:
                                                                                                                                Role: principal Comparator: XML Results/Expressions/Operators/CompExpr/FTContainsExpr/FTIgnoreOption/FTIgnore-q1.xml

                                                                                                                                  2.15Unconstrained Weight Range

                                                                                                                                  Negative weights. Sections 3 and 5.2.15.

                                                                                                                                    FTSelection-Weight-unconstrained-q1d Scenario: standard Creator: Full-Text Task Force, Jim
                                                                                                                                    Description:
                                                                                                                                    Positive test to demonstrate that weight is supported with some negative value
                                                                                                                                    Spec Citations:
                                                                                                                                    #id-weights-conf
                                                                                                                                    Query:

                                                                                                                                    Outputs:
